meanings.sent1: She tried to unround the dough by pressing it flat.
meanings.sent2: The ball started to unround as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to unround the balloon by squeezing it gently.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes unround the perfect circle into an abstract shape.
meanings.sent5: The potter used a tool to unround the edges of the clay bowl, giving it a unique look.

meanings.sent1: The machine was designed to unround the edges of metal pipes.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor carefully unrounded the corners of the marble block.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally unrounded the cake while trying to trim the edges.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter had to unround the wooden peg to fit it into the hole.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to unround the neckline of the dress to achieve the desired shape.

meanings.sent1: The unround table wobbled on its uneven legs.
meanings.sent2: The unround rock stood out among the smooth pebbles.
meanings.sent3: The unround wheel made the bicycle ride bumpy and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: Her unround face had distinct angles and edges.
meanings.sent5: The unround balloon floated awkwardly in the air, unable to maintain a circular shape.
